title: Product Manager Jackpot
description:
Jackpot Product Manager
  
We are looking for a Jackpot Product Manager who will help us with the responsibility for making Relax Gaming’s Jackpot products the best in the world. The ideal candidate has outstanding knowledge of jackpot products and software development lifecycle in order to be able to take our services to the next level.
  
Do you enjoy working closely with internal stakeholders and are you confident & passionate about driving
  
the end-to-end success of a product? Are you a natural in defining the roadmap, acting as a bridge between tech and business, as well as have a creative mind for new ideas? If so, we’d love to hear from you. 
  
You will be responsible for contributing towards the success of our Jackpot products including
  
**Product Strategy:** collaborate with stakeholders and help execute the overall product strategy for our Jackpot portfolio, ensuring alignment with business objectives and customer needs.
  
**Feature Conceptualisation and Prioritization:** define and prioritize features based on market trends, player and customer feedback, and business goals to enhance the gaming experience.
  
**Requirements Analysis:** gather requirements and create detailed scope documentation.
  
**Delivery:** lead the product release plan and set expectations for delivery of new functionalities.
  
**User Experience:** champion a user-centric approach and ensure that the Jackpot products meet high standards of usability, accessibility, and overall player satisfaction.
  
**Testing and Quality Assurance:** Collaborate with QA teams to ensure rigorous testing, identifying and addressing any issues or bugs to maintain high quality standards.
  
**Internal Collaboration:** Work closely with cross-functional teams, including developers, designers, and marketing to drive product development from concept to launch.
  
**Data-Driven Decision Making:** Utilize analytics and player data to make informed decisions, track product performance, and identify areas for improvement.
  
**Regulatory Compliance:** Stay informed about and ensure compliance with relevant gaming regulations, working closely with legal and compliance teams.
  
**Stakeholder Communication:** Regularly communicate with stakeholders, providing updates on product development, performance metrics, and any challenges or opportunities.
  
**Market Analysis:** Conduct market research and analysis to identify opportunities for innovation, competitive positioning, and differentiation in the iGaming industry.
  
Work in collaboration with the Account Management team to handle customer facing aspects of the Jackpot product, including training/presentations, handling issues raised by customers and support set up of promotions
  
  

**We are looking for someone with:**  

Bachelor's degree in a relevant field (e.g., Business, Marketing, Computer Science.)
  
Proven experience as a Product Manager or similar role in the iGaming industry.
  
2+ years of experience working with Jackpot products.
  
Strong understanding of casino gaming trends, player behaviour, and market dynamics.
  
Excellent communication, collaboration, and product management skills.
  
Ability to prioritize and manage multiple tasks in a dynamic environment.
  
Experience working with Atlassian suite or similar.
  
  

**You’ll have us extra excited if you have:**  

Understanding of UI/UX design best practices and ability to create simple mock-ups.
  
Understanding, at least conceptually, of common systems integration methodologies (decoupling of systems, APIs, task queues etc.).
  
Good understanding of gaming mechanics, games studios and games trends.
  
  

This role will be reporting to the Jackpot Business Owner.
  
About Relax Gaming
  
Relax Gaming Group was founded in 2010 with the goal of creating games for the modern iGaming landscape. Always staying true to the Relax core values - Driven, Adaptable, Supportive, and Respectful - the recent and rapid expansion has been conceived in order to deliver unparalleled global reach. Via a quick one-time integration, Relax Gaming now provides access to a roster of 1500+ casino games and a diverse range of proprietary products, including Poker, Bingo, and its own rapidly expanding slot portfolio.
  
The high-quality aggregated content is provided through its selected Silver Bullet (commercially represented) and Powered By Relax (commercially independent) partners. Regulated markets are also at the heart of its growth strategy, with both fully supported regulated markets as well as licenses held in multiple jurisdictions. Keen to find out more? Learn about us here.
  
Life at Relax
  
Relax is at a very exciting growth stage as a company; however, we cherish our informal and flexible core atmosphere where self-initiative, taking pride in what you do and ambition to deliver the best results are key components. For the right person, there are endless opportunities for personal and professional development.

title: React.js Front-End Intern

title: UX Designer
description:
We now have a new requirement and are looking for a consultant colleague with the qualifications listed below. The position is part of our consulting business, which means you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments.

*As part of your application, you may be presented to clients/partners as part of the recruitment process. If selected for the assignment, you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments as part of our consulting business.*  

  

**Job Description**

  

* Engage actively throughout the design process, from early discovery and prototyping to final interface design and feature follow-up
* Develop prototypes of various fidelities, together with product leaders and technical leads for user research, for desktop, tablet and mobile interfaces
* Conduct user research independently to gather insights directly from end-users
* Analyze user needs, business goals, and technical capabilities to inform UX decisions
* Map user journeys to enhance comprehension and design effective user flows that improve the overall experience
* Deliver finalized and validated designs ready for implementation and conducting design reviews with the product team
* Collaborate with developers, product leaders, and fellow designers to ensure seamless implementation
* Ensure overall user experiences are world-class, meeting agreed outcomes set with business stakeholders and product leaders

  

**Your Profile (Must-have requirements)**

  

* Demonstrated success in researching and user testing interactive product experiences
* Proficient in creating cohesive designs using established design systems
* Well-versed in user research tools and methodologies, with experience in both in-person and remote user testing
* Strong understanding of best practices, digital patterns, and web/mobile design standards
* Ability to design visual aspects and micro-interactions with a focus on digital accessibility, including WCAG compliance
* Skilled in workshop facilitation, problem definition, and analysis
* Expertise in Interaction Design with advanced Figma proficiency
* Both quantitative and qualitative data literacy
* Structured, action-oriented approach to design challenges

  

  

**Meritorious**

  

* Familiarity with empowered product teams and the product trio setup
* Exposure to global products with multi-lingual interfaces
* Experiences within sales or retail environments

  

  

  

**Application deadline:** 09-06-2025 **About Us**  

We currently employ experienced consultants in areas such as System Development, AI, Machine Learning, Testing, Cloud, Infra DevOps, and IT Project Management.  

  

Working at Deploja is something entirely different from working at an ordinary consulting company—and we are really proud of that. So, what makes us unique?  

  

We simply offer more than just a high salary and greater freedom; that’s just the beginning. With us, you’ll find the work environment and opportunities you deserve. Welcome to Deploja, where the grass is indeed greener!

 **Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**


Exciting assignments with our many clients. We focus on long-term projects, which gives you the opportunity to create value for the client while also developing yourself.


A secure monthly salary – together we’ll agree on a base salary depending on your assignments.


Company car – we encourage you to choose an electric car for a more sustainable future.


Occupational pension and great opportunities for salary conversion.


Vacation – Would you like more than 30 days of vacation, perhaps 60 days?


Private health insurance, accident insurance, and life insurance for increased security.


Skills development – you set your own budget and choose the training you wish to attend.


Quality of life – Are you struggling to balance everyday life and wish to work a little less while still earning as much, if not more?

*We handle applications continuously, and due to the high workload, it's especially important to include a short motivation for the position, explaining how you meet the requirements.*

title: Product Manager
description:
We are currently recruiting for a **Product Manager** to join our team and drive the strategy, development, and go-to-market execution of hardware, peripherals, and related services for Telecare markets across Europe, the UK, and APAC. This role is based at our office in Malmo or other Tunstall location in Spain (Madrid), Germany (Telgte) or the UK (Manchester), we estimate 20% of time will be travel and working from another base.

**What will you be doing in this role?**


As a **Product Manager** at Tunstall, you will oversee our core devices throughout their lifecycle – from ideation and concept development to launch, market rollout, and operations – ensuring successful deployment and operations in collaboration with regional product teams. Your expertise will be critical in delivering innovative, market-ready solutions that meet customer needs and business objectives.

**The Ideal candidate**:


You will have **proven experience in product management** preferably in a hardware of technical product development environment, and with familiarity of telecare concepts and the broader health care / assistive technology sector. A proven track record of integrating AI and data-driven thinking into product development is vital to the success of this role.


You will have a familiarity of Agile/ SAFe and **excellent communication skills**, both written and verbal, able to influence effectively. You will be an **adaptable**, **proactive**, **team player**, used to taking responsibility for your products with a **track record of delivering results**. To be successful in this role you will be highly customer focused, performance driven and able to work in an international set up.


This role will require some travel, including international travel.

**What we offer (some benefits may differ depending on whether based in Manchester or Malmo)**:

* A collaborative and inclusive team culture,
* Hybrid work setup,
* Collective agreement and competitive benefits,
* Service pension,
* Health care allowance,
* A modern office in Hyllie, Malmö, with excellent transport connections,
* Opportunities to grow your career in a meaningful industry where tech saves lives.

**Some of your key day to day tasks will be…**

* Monitor Telecare market trends, competitive products, and emerging technologies relevant to Tunstall’s business,
* Maintain subject matter expertise on company products and act as an internal authority,
* Conduct product positioning analysis and portfolio evaluations to align with evolving market demands,
* Support the Product Director in assessing new technologies and ordering technical investigations to enhance customer solutions,
* Collaborate with Product Teams and regional stakeholders to translate market needs into clear, actionable requirements,
* Partner with Delivery teams to ensure solutions meet customer expectations and are delivered on time,
* Advocate for the customer within development teams, providing market context for feature requests,
* Define non-functional requirements (performance, security, compliance, scalability, etc.) in alignment with technical experts,
* Prepare business cases, gate approvals, and support Investment Appraisals for new projects,
* Manage the product backlog, prioritize epics, and align development with business value,
* Review and approve feature descriptions, user journeys, and UX/development proposals,
* Support Global Product Marketing in creating launch materials and documentation,
* Work with Technical Product Managers to define testing criteria and validate features through UAT,
* Analyse product performance metrics and recommend improvements to inform the roadmap,
* Propose enhancements or new features that align with business goals and service revenue growth,
* Oversee end-of-life product transitions and manage phase-out strategies,
* Define technical requirements for engineering teams to support accurate tender estimations,
* Foster cross-functional teamwork to drive product excellence,
* Champion Tunstall’s leadership behaviours and promote a collaborative, high-performance culture,
* Challenge constructively, build credibility, and influence stakeholders at all levels,
* Adapt to a culturally diverse business environment and integrate best practices,
* Serve as the customer’s voice in strategic and operational decisions.

**Key skills and experience**:

* Proven Product Management experience, preferably in a hardware or technical product development environment,
* Familiarity with Telecare concepts and the broader healthcare/assistive technology sector.
* Proven track record in integrating AI and data-driven thinking into product development,
* Experience working in multicultural, multinational teams with cross-functional collaboration,
* Strong influencing and stakeholder management skills, with the ability to engage at all organisational levels,
* Excellent written and verbal communication, with the ability to articulate complex ideas clearlys
* Proficiency in MS Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook),
* Agile/SAFe familiarity – experience in backlog management, roadmap development, and feature prioritization,
* Market analysis expertise – ability to assess trends, customer needs, and competitive landscapes,
* Customer-focused, performance-driven, and committed to delivering high-quality results,
* Adaptable, resilient, and able to thrive in a dynamic, evolving market,
* Self-motivated, able to act on initiative and manage priorities effectively.

**Desirable skills and experience**:

* Knowledge of cloud-based services, app development, or IoT integrations,
* Experience as an Agile Product Owner (SCRUM),
* Advanced technical degree (e.g., MSc, MBA) or certifications in Product Management,
* Background in hardware-software platform integrations.

**If you are not sure if you have the relevant skills or experience, then please apply (only takes a few minutes) and let our team review and come back to you.**

**A bit about us**:


Tunstall is a **market-leading health** and **care technology provider**.


We’re passionate about ensuring our team reflects the brilliant and unique qualities of the people and communities we support. Our **incredible team of more than 3,000 colleagues provides life saving** and **life changing technology** and **services to millions of people in 18 different countries**.


At Tunstall you’ll find a place where you’re valued and celebrated for being yourself. We empower our people to deliver the very best teamwork, innovation and thought leadership by creating an environment where we champion diversity and inclusion. We demonstrate our commitment to diversity and inclusion at each step. From our open, fair, and transparent recruitment processes, through to the many development and career growth opportunities we provide.

**Each Tunstall colleague has a superpower… they’re unique. No one else is them, and we think that’s special. Come and join our mission and be part of our team, our One Tunstall team.**

title: E-Commerce Manager
description:
Are you a strategic and hands-on e-commerce professional ready to take full ownership of digital sales across multiple channels? At Sweed, we’re looking for an **E-commerce Manager** to lead and grow our e-commerce ecosystem – from our website to TikTok Shop, marketplaces, and emerging platforms.

### **About the role**


As E-commerce Manager, you’ll be responsible for the full digital sales journey across all platforms. You’ll own channel strategy, optimize conversion, improve user experience, and drive growth through data-driven decisions. Working cross-functionally with marketing, tech, and external partners, you’ll ensure a seamless and scalable e-commerce experience aligned with our brand goals.

### **Key responsibilities**

* Manage performance and growth across website, TikTok Shop, and other digital sales channels.
* Optimize UX, conversion funnels, and customer journeys using tools like A/B testing and behavior analytics.
* Lead the implementation of new features, tools, and technologies to enhance the e-commerce experience.
* Own digital merchandising, site structure, and cross-/upselling strategies.
* Ensure all channels align with our brand and business goals.
* Collaborate on launch plans, campaigns, and retention strategies.
* Analyze KPIs and customer data to identify opportunities and drive action.


### **About you**

* 3–5 years in a similar e-commerce role, preferably across multiple channels.
* Strong grasp of digital commerce, UX, analytics, and customer behavior.
* Data-driven, commercially minded, and solution-oriented.
* Experience with platforms like Google Analytics, Centra, Storyblok, and TikTok Shop is a plus.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills in both Swedish and English.


### **Location**


The role is on-site at our office in Stockholm and on a full-time basis. We would love for you to start as soon as possible.

title: Internship Program Devs, Ops and Legal
description:
**APPLICATION DEADLINE:** June 17th  

We will only start processing applications once the deadline is over.

**Bitrefill Internship program:**
---------------------------------


We're launching an unorthodox Internship program and are looking for ambitious and proactive people who are eager to create wonders with us and learn along the way!


You'll get real-life work experience in your field and will be encouraged to roll up your sleeves, get things done and learn along the way.

  

You will join a driven, ambitious, and inspirational team where crypto is money for everyday use, so you'll also get great education on everything involving cryptocurrency.

  

3 Internship openings:



* Developer internship


* Operations internship


* Legal & Compliance internship


**What is Bitrefill?**
----------------------

We're making the world easier for people to live on crypto.


Bitrefill has been remote-first since before it was cool. We believe in the freedom to work remotely and flexibly; we are built around this. You’re given real ownership over your work and the trust to get things done. There’s always someone around to bounce ideas off and collaborate with, as well as regular meetups and conferences to keep things connected beyond the screen.


### **1. De****veloper Internship**

*This is a 6-months internship*  

  

**Requirements:**  



* Studies and/or experience with frontend, backend, fullstack, mobile dev—or other cool skills
* Experience with: vanilla JS, Node.js, TypeScript, React, React Native, or MongoDB (depending on your field).
* Agility when it comes to workflows. Teams work in an agile environment where serendipity is how we find our way forward.
* Be hungry to learn, fast to execute, do a lot with little, and care strongly about our product and users
* Interest and understanding of bitcoin and cryptocurrencies is not required but is definitely a plus!

**Responsibilities:**

* Working with the team on UX, functionality and speed of our app and platform
* Be involved in supplier integrations, Lightning, Bitcoin and cryptocurrency services.
* Building and deploying new code, features and products, as well as maintaining old code
* Support our customer service team in technical support requests and tools

### **2. Legal & Compliance Internship:**

*This is a 1-month internship*  

  

**Requirements:**  



* Attention to detail
* Organization skills
* Eagerness to learn
* Interest around compliance and contracts
* Legal or Compliance background isn't required but is a plus!
* 

**Responsibilities:**

  

* Contract mapping and organization
* Handle KYC and KYB processes
* Other legal and compliance tasks

### **3. Operations Internship:**

*This is a 6-months internship*  

  

**Requirements:**

* 1+ year of Operations experience - this includes experience at a student organization, startup, conference, volunteer group or other fast-paced and slightly chaotic environments ;)
* Good organization skills with attention to detail
* Proactiveness and good social skills
* Good communication skills
* Multi-tasking abilities
* AI tools familiarity

**Responsibilities:**

* Various organizational research projects
* Helping us keep internal knowledge organized and easy to find
* Assisting with planning and operations for our team retreats
* Supporting HR Operations tasks including onboarding and admin tasks

**What we offer:**
------------------

* A super-talented team that will guide you through the internship;
* Being part of a passionate team with a mission of enabling financial freedom;
* We welcome the crypto curious and experts, and are happy to help you learn;
* Freedom to work from anywhere;
* Learning allowance to support your growth process;
* Team retreats to get to know your team in person;
* The 3 Internship openings are compensated;
* For some roles, the possibility of joining the team full-time after the internship.
  

**The Hiring Process:**
-----------------------


* Apply to the internship by June 17th;


* Record Video Interview and submit Online Assessment;


* Work on Practical Assignment;


* Presentation Interview; and


* References & Background Checks.

title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
**Join our Team**
-----------------


**About this opportunity**


Are you interested in being part of our digital success? Group IT is the trusted digital partner to Ericsson, creating insight, innovation and experience at the speed of our business. We maximize the value of data and technology to fuel the Digital Transformation of Ericsson. More on Group IT’s mission here or click on the link: https://bit.ly/35pxjmb

  



We are growing and are looking for two experienced and ambitious Senior Software Engineers with drive and a passion for creating outstanding solutions! You will join a team that has a true agile mindset, innovation culture, fast pace and where you have opportunity to make an impact. In return, we expect you to have a deep motivation for your own personal development as well as sharing your knowledge and being active in creating a fun work environment.

 **What you will do**


You will work in a multicultural agile team with dedicated passionate colleagues to develop digital products using the latest technology and techniques. We put a lot of emphasis on continuous learning, innovation and expect you to actively contribute.

 **The skills you bring**

* A BSc/MSc level in Computer Science or the equivalent level of knowledge
* Minimum 5+ years of work experience
* Passion to learn about and experiment with relevant tech platforms and software stacks. Examples include Azure, AWS, Kubernetes, JavaScript, .NET Core, Java. You likely want to add to this list, and you can explain why to other developers.
* Experience with software development fundamentals such as TDD, continuous integration/ continuous deployment, code reviews, source control, work item/issue tracking
* Experience with technical architecture standards, security and frameworks
* Experience in working in agile teams, collaborating with other teams and disciplines to deliver software from MVP phase to full scale
* Experience in designing and building cloud-native apps and cloud services that run at scale.

  

Experience in below is an advantage  

* Skills in GUI and Ux development
* Knowledge of algorithms and data structures
* Experience in mentoring junior developers
 **Application**  

The positions can be based in Borås, Gothenburg or Stockholm. We are reviewing applications on a rolling basis, so we encourage you to apply as soon as possible. Kindly note that we do not accept applications sent via e-mail.

**Why join Ericsson?**


At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.

 **What happens once you apply?**


Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.


We encourage you to consider applying to jobs where you might not meet all the criteria. We recognize that we all have transferrable skills, and we can support you with the skills that you need to develop.


Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.

 **Primary country and city:** Sweden (SE) || Borås

**Job details:** Software Engineer

title: Product Owner
description:
Join one of the leading **Translation & Localization** Companies in the world! **Future Group** Company is leading the localization market since 1994 with global subsidiaries serving North & Latin America, Asia, Europe, and MEA.


We're currently expanding our team globally, join our global team in our new journey now!


We are hiring Product Owner for one of Future Group subsidiaries.


**Job Description:**


As a Product Owner , your primary responsibility will be to drive the development and execution of innovative financial technology products. You will work closely with cross-functional teams, including engineers, designers, data scientists, and business stakeholders, to define and deliver high-quality solutions that meet customer needs and drive business growth. Your role will involve a combination of strategic thinking, product management, and project coordination.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Collaborate with stakeholders to define and communicate the product vision, strategy, and roadmap. Understand market trends, user needs, and industry regulations to identify opportunities and shape the product direction.
* Break down the product roadmap into detailed user stories, epics, and features. Prioritize product features and enhancements based on customer value, business impact, and technical feasibility.
* Conduct market research, user interviews, and data analysis to gather insights and define clear product requirements. Document and communicate these requirements effectively to the development team.
* Work in an Agile development environment, collaborate with the development team to plan and execute product releases. Monitor project progress, remove obstacles, and ensure timely delivery of features.
* Collaborate closely with designers, engineers, and other stakeholders to oversee the end-to-end product development lifecycle. Provide guidance and make product decisions to ensure high-quality deliverables.
* Build strong relationships with internal and external stakeholders, including executives, customers, and partners. Engage with stakeholders to gather feedback, communicate product updates, and manage expectations.
* Advocate for a user-centric approach throughout the product development process. Conduct usability testing, analyze user feedback, and iterate on product features to enhance user experience.
* Collaborate with marketing and sales teams to plan and execute product launches. Develop go-to-market strategies, create product documentation, and support customer onboarding activities.
* Define and track key product metrics, analyze data to measure the success of product initiatives. Identify areas for improvement and make data-driven decisions to optimize product performance.

 **Qualifications and Skills:**

* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Business, or a related field.
* Proven experience as a Product Owner, Product Manager, or similar role in the fintech industry.
* Strong knowledge of financial technology and understanding of industry trends, regulations, and customer needs.
* Experience working in Agile development methodologies.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams and stakeholders.
* Analytical mindset with the ability to gather and interpret data to inform product decisions.
* Strong organizational skills, attention to detail, and ability to manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment.
* Familiarity with UX/UI principles and ability to advocate for a user-centered design approach.
* Prior experience in launching successful fintech products and driving user adoption is a plus.

  

**Work Conditions:**  

Part-time

title: UX/UI Designer
description:
At Ubiquiti Inc., we create technology platforms for Businesses, Smart Homes, and Internet Service Providers, driven by our goal to connect everyone, everywhere by Rethinking IT. To date, Ubiquiti has shipped over 100 million devices worldwide, from ISP networking products to next generation of IT solutions. At Ubiquiti, you’ll heighten your potential and broaden your horizons, while shaping the future of connectivity.
   

  

**We are currently looking for a highly skilled UX/UI Designer to our team in Stockholm, Sweden.**
***Please note that applicants must live in Sweden and hold a valid work permit at the time of application to be considered for this role.***
**Responsibilities**
* Design high-quality and user-friendly interfaces for web and mobile. Examples: UniFi Network app, UniFi Protect app, UniFi Design System, ui.com, store.ui.com, design.ui.com and more
* Embrace a design-first approach, pushing the boundaries of design by working on new and innovative ideas
* Co-work with key stakeholders including leadership, strategists, developers (FE/FS) and other designers
* Navigate an agile work environment, iterating quickly yet maintaining high quality
* Actively participate in mulitple projects across the company and voice your ideas on design improvements


**Requirements**
* Expert level UX and UI design skills
* Minimum five (5) years of experience designing interfaces for web and mobile
* Highly proficient in Figma
* Strong interest in working hands-on with design, considering both user experience and UIs
* You take full ownership of your tasks and responsibilites
* Genuine passion for great UX
* Excellent communication skills and highly proficient in English (written and spoken)


**Nice To Have**
* Knowledge about networking & wireless technologies
* Experience with Adobe After Effects or any other animation tool for interactions
* Skilled in Cinema 4D or Blender


**Benefits**
* International work environment
* Competitive compensation package including wellness allowance, occupational pension, medical insurance, private health insurance, life insurance and work-injury insurance
* Five weeks of holiday per year
* Flexible work hours and hybrid work model
* Modern office space located in Epicenter (Hötorget)
* Access to all the latest Ubiquiti products and prototypes for home use and tests


***Please note that a background check will be conducted in the final stage of the recruitment process***

title: Product Designer
description:
**About Filed**
 Filed is building the
 **first AI tax preparer** 
 trusted by America’s accounting firms. This industry might seem boring—but it’s a $70B backbone of the economy that’s breaking under a talent shortage no one has solved. We’re fixing it—fast.
   

  

 In just 9 months, we’ve hit
 **strong product-market fit** 
 , are generating
 **fast-growing, sticky revenue** 
 , and are
 **backed by top-tier investors** 
 . We’re not a tool—we’re the missing workforce firms have been sounding the alarm for. We’re building the future with expanding our already 30 person team, with those who want to say
 **“I was there when it all started.”**
 ⸻
   

  

**About The Role**
 We're looking for someone who loves digging in to a complex user problem, really get to the core of it, and explore solutions without spending days/weeks wireframing and researching. We're looking for a quick and outcome-driven problem solver.
   

  

 Unlike most designers who specialise in one area, you’re a generalist with a complete toolkit: crafting excellent user experiences, elegant user interfaces, and translating scrappy ideas into working prototypes to test your ideas.
   

  

 As our second design hire, you’ll co-own the full product experience, collaborating closely with engineering, machine learning and our users as we build something that fundamentally changes the way tax professionals work. Less than a year ago, they said it was impossible.
   

  

 Our product and engineering team is based in
 **Stockholm** 
 . We’re prioritising local candidates, but will
 **consider candidates from elsewhere in the EU, who can travel to Stockholm.**
 This job isn’t for everyone - that’s the point
   

  

* If you’re looking for a role where you need full clarity, weeks of discovery or research, before making a decision - this probably isn’t the right fit.
* We move fast, week to week. Sometimes we ship the wrong thing. Often, we ship the right thing. Either way, we learn fast and keep building.
* When you take an extra few days to refine a flow or tweak in Figma, there might already be a team blocked behind you. That’s the pace.
* There are no lone wolves here - you must be highly collaborative.


 You’ll be a strong fit if you
   

  

* Have worked at an early-stage startup and love the energy, ambiguity and ownership it brings
* Have front-end knowledge to build prototypes to validate your ideas quickly (at Filed, we're using Lovable)
* Have a strong problem-solving mindset, and can navigate messy, evolving problem spaces
* Know how to collaborate closely with engineers, from shaping the problem to shipping the solution
* Love speaking with users - we chat with them weekly
* You own your work, and the accountability that come with it.


 Your skillset
   

  

* Have a passion for crafting amazing UX, UI and interaction solutions
* Detail-oriented but pragmatic mindset, knowing where and when polish matters
* Strong understanding of A11y accessibility
* You've embraced AI tools to speed up your workflow. We’re using tools like Lovable to test our ideas as quickly as possible.
* Have 3+ years experience shipping impactful products


**We expect you to have a portfolio showcasing successful products you’ve shipped.**
**Growth and Levels**
 We operate on six levels, from Level 1 to Level 6. Each reflects increasing ownership, impact, and scope with meaningful jumps in salary and equity.
   

  

 We review levels every 4 months. Promotions are based on output and ownership, not tenure.
   

  

 This isn’t a comfy design role. It’s fast, focused, and user-centered.
   

  

 You will build fast. You will learn fast. You will own what you ship.
   

  

 We operate with total transparency around pay, performance, and progress.
   

  

 ⸻
   

  

**The process**
* Quick intro call with our CEO
* Portfolio walkthrough and design task with our founding designer
* Final round with our team
* (Optional) 2 to 3 day paid trial
* Then, we decide together if this is the right fight


 ⸻
   

  

 If you want to build something real, fast, and far beyond pretty UI, this is it.
   

  

 Compensation Range: $55K - $84.5K

title: Graphic Design Internship
description:
Join Our Diverse Team At Crane Currency In a Graphic Design Internship In Tumba And Be a Part Of Our Journey Towards Innovation And Excellence. Who We Are
   

  

 Crane Currency is a premier industrial technology company and a pioneer in currency manufacturing and advanced micro-optics technology for securing physical products. Yes, chances are you have our product in your wallet right now! Our sophisticated equipment and software leverage proprietary core capabilities with detection and sensing technologies. Around the world, our customers trust us to anticipate their needs with innovative, reliable, and high-quality currency & authentication solutions and services—just as they have for generations.  Learn more at
   

  

**How You Will Make An Impact**
 As a Graphic Design Intern, you will be part of the Design team and contribute to creating visually stunning and impactful designs that will be seen by audiences worldwide. As an intern, you will engage in projects that require interpreting creative briefs into compelling visual concepts, showcased across various media platforms. You will leverage your creative expertise in graphic design to capture essential design elements and transform them into innovative and captivating visuals that enhance brand identity and communication.
   

  

**In Your Role You Will**
* Create and Design Banknotes: Design content for new banknotes and redesign. Support Banknote designer or Engraver with Graphic design content, typography and illustrations. Support with administrative task related to design proposals, presentations and deliverables related.
* Incorporate Security Features: Create content for security features and support Banknote designer.
* Collaborate with Stakeholders: Work with Crane and Global design team in to ensure designs meet all requirements.
* Conduct Research: Investigate cultural and historical elements to incorporate into banknote designs, ensuring they are meaningful and relevant.
* Develop Prototypes: Support the process of creation of prototypes to ensure the durability and functionality of the banknotes.
* Stay Updated on Trends: Keep abreast of the latest trends in design and security to continuously improve banknote designs.
* Document Design Processes: Maintain accurate records of all design activities and provide detailed specifications for printers and engravers. Support with our planning document and other related administrative task in design.


****Knowledge and expertise that matter most for this role:****
**Required**
* Must be a student throughout the duration of the internship
* Available to work 20 hours per week
* 
* 1 - 2-year university level education in arts & crafts and graphic design or commensurate experience.
* 
* 1 - 2 years’ experience within the field of graphic design.
* 
* Knowledge of graphic design software such as Illustrator, Photoshop and indesign.
* 
* Fluent in English.


**Preferred**
* 
* Experience working with team and with continues improvements


***Ability to showcase artwork and graphic design, including drawings (portfolio submission preferred)***
**Benefits**
****Tumba-Benefits****
****How we will care for you:****
 We offer top-notch medical benefits including a wellness allowance and reimbursement for medicines and medical care, opportunities for personal development, community engagement activities, competitive compensation, vacation, parental leave, and multiple tiers of retirement plans. Discover more about our benefits here
   

  

**What Drives Our Team**
 We are a passionate team of 1,200 creators and problem solvers, united by our purpose, we give people confidence every day in moments that matter. This comes to life through our Shared Values:
   

  

* People Matter
* Do the Right Thing
* Trusted Partner
* Innovate for Growth
* Always Improving


**Learn More About Our Values And Culture**
 You can also check us out at:
   

  

**Where We Are**
 Your role is in Tumba, Stockholm, located in the historic Tumba Bruk area, five-minute walking distance from the train station, 30 km south of Stockholm, and about 20 minutes from Stockholm Central Station. Check out what makes Tumba a great place to live and work here:
   

  

 Crane Currency is a drug free workplace.
   

  

 Crane NXT is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, disability, national origin or any other characteristic protected under applicable local law.

**#ONSITE**
 #cranecurrency, #opentowork, #jobsearch, #hireme, #jobhunt, #jobseeker, #hiring, #recruitment, #jobsearching, #employment, #careers, #nowhiring #TUMBA

title: Product Analyst - Mobility
description:
**THE OPPORTUNITY IN A NUTSHELL**
**You?** 
 You have 3+ years of experience as a product analyst in e-commerce, digital product or marketplace companies. You have experience working with modern data stacks, behavioural analysis and experimentation. You thrive in a fast-changing environment and are good at connecting with colleagues both online and offline. Having a passion for cars, boats, and motorcycles is a plus.
   

  

**Role?** 
 You will empower the Product teams to make data-driven decisions and drive product development through insights, instrumentation and experimentation.
   

  

**Tech stack?** 
 Essential skills: Tableau, Amplitude, SQL, Snowflake, Google Slides, A/B testing. Bonus skills/experience: dbt, Python, Kafka, Data Mesh principles, Machine Learning and Large Language Model.
   

  

**Location?** 
 Work hybrid, spending a few days a week at our modern offices in Stockholm, Oslo, or Aarhus to promote team collaboration. Prefer an office environment? You’re welcome to join us daily.
   

  

**Company?** 
 We empower people to make smart choices for themselves and future generations through our leading and loved marketplace brands across the Nordics: Blocket, Bytbil and Wheelaway in Sweden. FINN and Nettbil in Norway. DBA and Bilbasen in Denmark. Tori and Autovex in Finland. Combined, our marketplaces receive 100M monthly visits, generating billions of behavioural data points. Currently, we’re in a historic change, consolidating to a common marketplace platform across the Nordics.
   

  

**The team?** 
 You will join the Mobility Insight & Analytics team. We are a team of six product and business analysts and one data scientist, who are based across the Nordics. We support product teams and business stakeholders within the Mobility vertical i.e., Cars, Boats and Motorcycles. We collaborate closely with data platform teams e.g. Data Engineers, Data Modelling Teams, and the horizontal Insight & Analytics team.
   

  

**Why us?** 
 In this role, you will have the opportunity to make a meaningful impact. We hold strong, unique positions across all our segments in the Nordics. Specifically, the Mobility vertical is driving transformation in electrification and the online buying experience, creating a dynamic environment full of opportunities. At our core, we unite across countries, brands, and teams, embracing a culture where we dare to speak up, challenge the status quo, and try new things. We take pride in delivering on our promises and turning bold ideas into real impact.
   

  

**Sounds like your cup of tea? Check out the details below!**
**WHO ARE YOU?**
 You build strong relationships with colleagues and stakeholders. You communicate data and insights in an engaging and visual way and switch between details and overviews to navigate complex business landscapes. You turn vast data into actionable insights, elevating our understanding of marketplace user behaviour.
   

  

**WHAT'S THE JOB LIKE?**
* Analyze and understand user journeys using product analytics tools
* Advise on hypotheses and insight needs for product development
* Facilitate analytics needs for organizational transformation and product migration
* Identify and advise on data needs, like missing events or data points
* Help set up (with tech) and analyze experiments
* Advise on prioritizing outputs to help reach product goals
* Monitor product performance and vertical user metrics
* Work in cross-functional teams (e.g., developers, product managers, and UX) to develop the product
* Advise stakeholders on setting product KPIs, tracking them, and using them


**What We Offer**
 At Vend, we offer a range of benefits designed to support your well-being, professional growth and work-life balance. Note that specific benefits may vary by office location.
   

  

* Learning & Development: Access to Vend Learning Lab, external courses, conferences, Hackdays, and leadership development programs
* Health & Wellbeing: Comprehensive health insurance, mental health support, and access to gym facilities, physiotherapy, and sports interest groups. Discounts on fitness memberships
* Parental & Sick Leave: Enhanced parental leave benefits, full salary during illness for up to one year, and additional leave days
* Pension & Insurance: Defined contribution pension plans and extensive insurance coverage, including accident, critical illness, and travel insurance
* Food & Social Activities: Subsidized healthy meals, barista coffee, and various social events like after-work, gatherings, holiday parties, and family activities
* Employee Share Saving Plan: Opportunity to buy shares with additional complimentary shares after two years
* Holiday Homes: Access to holiday homes for rent at popular destinations
* Home Office Support: Office equipment for home office setup, including a monthly compensation for extra expenses


**GOT YOUR ATTENTION?**
 Apply as soon as possible to this role where you can share knowledge, learn, grow, and make a difference. We value diversity and welcome applicants from all backgrounds. Inclusion for us means creating a fair workspace where each of us is respected, celebrated for who we are, and given equal opportunities to thrive.
