title: IT Specialist
description:
**Location:** 

 Office in Medborgarplatsen - Stockholm, Sweden (Occasional remote work)
 






**Type:** 

 Full-time, Parental Leave Cover (9 months from August to April)
 






**Contract:** 

 Temporary with the possibility of extension
 






**Start Date:** 

 August 2025
 




  




**About Envar Studios** 

  






 Envar Studios is a creative development and outsourcing studio based in Sweden, committed to excellence in art, design, and game development. As we continue to grow, we are seeking a proactive and service-minded IT Manager to support the technological needs of our team and clients.
 





 If you are passionate about IT infrastructure, problem-solving, and supporting a dynamic creative environment, this role offers a unique opportunity to make an impact across the studio’s operations.
   





**Your Role** 


 We’re looking for a
 
**hands-on, service-minded IT Specialist** 

 to join our team on a 9-month parental leave cover with the possibility of a longer-term role as we continue to grow our IT department. This is an exciting opportunity for someone ready to take operational ownership of a broad set of IT responsibilities, executing day-to-day support and contributing to long-term technical stability..
 





 In this role, you'll be the go-to person for all things IT supporting both client operations and internal team needs. You will work closely with stakeholders, manage hardware/software logistics, and ensure our tech setup is running smoothly and securely. 
 





 What matters most is a proactive mindset, strong communication skills, and a solid grasp of modern IT tools and infrastructure.
 




  




**Key Responsibilities** 
* Serve as the primary IT contact for internal teams and external clients
* Provide hands-on support for hardware, software, server security, and remote systems
* Set up, maintain, and manage company tech equipment and software
* Oversee employee onboarding/offboarding from a technical perspective
* Support and enforce cybersecurity policies and ensure compliance
* Troubleshoot and administer tools like Google Workspace, Favro, Miro, and Slack
* Monitor and manage security certificates and system updates
* Manage IT equipment purchasing and inventory in line with budgetary guidelines.
* Support the preparation of quotes and cost estimates to assist in budget planning and setup.
* Support virtual infrastructure via VMware and Azure
* Offer user training and maintain operational documentation
* Stay current with tech trends and align IT operations with company plans
* Translate client technical needs into internal actions and solutions
* Administration of software licensing.



  





  




**Who You Are** 
* **Service-oriented** 

 and communicative, you enjoy helping people and solving problems
* **Organized and proactive** 

 , you plan ahead, prioritize tasks, and work independently
* **Reliable and mature** 

 , you manage your time effectively and take ownership
* A
 
**tech-savvy generalist** 

 with a strong understanding of networking and troubleshooting
* Able to
 
**translate technical language into user-friendly solutions** 

 for non-technical teams


**Required Skills & Experience** 
* Experience with system administration, cybersecurity, and software management
* Minimum
 
**2 years of relevant experience** 

 , ideally with:
* Microsoft Azure
* Microsoft Defender for Endpoint
* Microsoft Intune
* Google Workspace
* Hands-on experience with remote management and MDM solutions
* Strong grasp of network basics, hardware setup, and troubleshooting



  




**Bonus Points For** 
* A background in
 
**gaming or game development environments**



  




**Interested?** 


 We’d love to hear from you. Apply now and tell us how you can help keep our studio connected, secure, and running smoothly.
 





 If you have any questions please send us an email to:
 
 soledad@envarstudio.com

title: Retail Analytical Consultant
description:
* Full-time
* Career Site Team: Data Science & Business Intelligence


**Job Description**
 Would you like to work within the grocery and convenience retail industry? In this role, you will collaborate closely with some of the largest retailers in Sweden, helping them make better decisions based on insights and NielsenIQ data.
   

  

**Key Respobsibilities**
* Build strong partnerships with the client and delight them by delivering analytical insights, presentations and thought leadership in line with commitments.
* Contribute to client retention by sharing data-driven insights, and supporting their decision-making processes client needs within data driven decisions to support their business.
* Analyze information and collaborate with team members to create impactful presentations. Present findings and recommendations clearly and concisely to stakeholders.
* Deliver best in class insights and presentations tailored to category managers, C-level executives, consumer insights teams, and other stakeholders.
* Take the lead on client accounts. Set the strategy for the account and ensure successful execution.
* Develop and maintain annual joint business plans in close cooperation with the client, ensuring financial targets and KPI’s (such as client satisfaction) are met.
* Work with NielsenIQ’s tools and systems, including Discover, MS Dynamics, and MS Office.
* Be onsite with clients (frequency will be decided based on clients’ portfolio, approximately 2 days per week)


**WHAT IS THE PERFECT CANDIDATE?**
* An analytical mindset and approach
* Ability to draw conclusions from large datasets and present them in a simplified, visualized format.
* Pays attention to details and uses analytical analysis methods
* A good listener when it comes to the client-facing part, with strong presentation and communication skills
* Highly driven, enjoys a variety of tasks, and adapts well to change


**Key Requirements**
* Minimum 2-4 years of professional or internship experience in the Retail or FMCG industry
* Strong analytical and problem-solving mindset and/or sales experience in a client-facing role, preferably in market research or with FMCG clients or retailers.
* Confidence with numbers and the ability to translate numbers into insights and recommendations.
* Strong presentation skills.
* Ability to work independently when onsite with clients
* Strong interpersonal and networking skills, with the ability to build trust and long-term client relationships
* An engaged and ambitious mindset, unafraid to challenge the status quo.
* Fluent in Swedish and English.


  

  

**WHAT CAN WE OFFER YOU?**
* Professional Growth - You will have a chance to grow with us, leading important clients in Sweden and facing challenges that will bring you to the next stage in your career. You will get the chance to work on exciting projects with leading industry clients and build a strong network.
* Training & Development - You will learn about all the services that NielsenIQ provides. Employees are encouraged to pursue growth opportunities and are provided with professional training to enable them to stay at the forefront of the latest marketing trends.
* Benefits - In addition to your salary, we offer a comprehensive non-financial benefits package, including collective agreements (occupational pension and parental leave), access to our office facility in Strandvägen 7, Stockholm, and the opportunity to work with a dedicated team and in a collaborative and inclusive work environment.
* Great Culture - Our core values are client obsessed, driven to win, accountable for results and committed to integrity. You will experience a dynamic, open, international, and solution-oriented environment where you can simply be yourself.


  

  

**ARE YOU THE ONE WE ARE LOOKING FOR?**
 Apply now by clicking the “Apply” button. We will be reviewing applications on an ongoing basis, and we will close the ad once we have hired our new colleague. Therefore, we encourage you to apply as soon as possible.
   

  

 Additional Information
   

  

**Our Benefits**
* Flexible working environment
* Volunteer time off
* LinkedIn Learning
* Employee-Assistance-Program (EAP)


**About NIQ**
 NIQ is the world’s leading consumer intelligence company, delivering the most complete understanding of consumer buying behavior and revealing new pathways to growth. In 2023, NIQ combined with GfK, bringing together the two industry leaders with unparalleled global reach. With a holistic retail read and the most comprehensive consumer insights—delivered with advanced analytics through state-of-the-art platforms—NIQ delivers the Full View™. NIQ is an Advent International portfolio company with operations in 100+ markets, covering more than 90% of the world’s population.
   

  

 For more information, visit NIQ.com
   

  

 Want to keep up with our latest updates?
   

  

 Follow us on: LinkedIn | Instagram | Twitter | Facebook
   

  

**Our commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion**
 NIQ is committed to reflecting the diversity of the clients, communities, and markets we measure within our own workforce. We exist to count everyone and are on a mission to systematically embed inclusion and diversity into all aspects of our workforce, measurement, and products. We enthusiastically invite candidates who share that mission to join us. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action-Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, protected veteran status or any other protected class. Our global non-discrimination policy covers these protected classes in every market in which we do business worldwide. Learn more about how we are driving diversity and inclusion in everything we do by visiting the NIQ News Center: https://nielseniq.com/global/en/news-center/diversity-inclusion I'm interested
   

  

 I'm interested

title: Group IT Director
description:
Are you a forward-thinking, motivated individual ready to lead a strategic IT function in a people-first, design-driven tech company? Solita is looking for a Group IT Director to shape and scale our internal systems and tools as we grow across Europe.
 



  





 Solita is a rapidly growing Nordic technology, data, and design consulting company. With 2,200+ professionals in 10 countries, we tackle meaningful challenges through human-centered design and cutting-edge technology. We deliver lasting impact through strategic consulting, service design, software development, data and analytics, AI, and cloud services.
 



  





 In this strategically important leadership role, you won’t just support our international growth, you’ll help define the structure and culture of a modern, decentralized digital transformation company. As Group IT Director, you'll play a key role in ensuring our internal platforms and tools enable our business across borders.
 



  





**About the Role** 




 In this role, you will report to Solita’s executive team and take on a group-wide leadership role in shaping and coordinating IT across countries and business areas. You will work closely with stakeholders at all levels, from end users to C-level executives, to ensure that the company’s internal platforms are integrated, scalable, and aligned with real business needs.
 



  





 This role can also be stationed in Solita's HQ in Helsinki.
 



  





**Key responsibilities include:** 



* Defining and executing the IT roadmap for core internal systems such as ERP, CRM, HR, recruitment, and planning tools.
* Ensuring effective coordination between local and group-level requirements, with a focus on harmonization, scalability, and readiness for future acquisitions.
* Overseeing system architecture, software asset management, and security, collaborating closely with in-house technical expertise.
* Empowering and leading a 20-person distributed IT team across the Nordics, with 3–5 direct reports.
* Acting as a bridge between business and technology, ensuring the right data is available in the right systems to support daily operations and long-term growth.
* Driving cost-conscious, fit-for-purpose solutions that balance strategic direction with day-to-day needs.
* Building governance structures, communication channels, and accountability frameworks across IT domains.



  





 This role requires close collaboration across multiple geographies and functions. You will play a key role in supporting Solita’s sustainable growth by aligning tools, people, and priorities—turning complexity into structure and vision into execution.
 



  





**Who We Are Looking For** 




 We are seeking an experienced IT leader who can connect business goals with innovative, scalable solutions. You thrive in a flat, collaborative organization where influence is earned through clarity, credibility, and trust, not hierarchy.
 



  





 You bring a rare combination of strategic vision and hands-on delivery focus. You understand what it takes to lead in a growing international company, and you know how to balance local autonomy with group-wide alignment.
 



  





**We believe you have:** 



* Solid leadership experience from a mid- to large-scale organization, ideally with exposure to international expansion and M&A-related integration work.
* A proven ability to lead IT initiatives across ERP, CRM, HR, or other business-critical platforms—delivering systems that work not just in theory, but in practice.
* A strong grasp of system architecture, IT governance, and security, paired with the ability to guide others through complexity with clarity.
* Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills, with the ability to build consensus across diverse teams and geographies.
* Fluency in English required. Nordic language skills are beneficial but not mandatory.
* Experience working with Microsoft-based environments, while remaining technology-agnostic and focused on business value.
* A structured, cost-conscious, and data-informed mindset.
* Experience from a similar context, such as consulting, digital professional services, or other people-centric, tech-driven industries, is highly desirable.



  





 You’re someone who sees the bigger picture but doesn’t hesitate to dive into details when needed. You lead with a combination of structure and flexibility, as well as empathy and decisiveness. Most importantly, you know how to create clarity and build trust in a changing environment.
 



  





**About the Company** 




 At Solita, we are committed to helping businesses innovate and grow sustainably. By integrating advanced data, cloud, and AI technologies with human-centered design, we provide comprehensive solutions that drive operational efficiency and foster long-term growth. We believe in empowering our clients to harness the power of technology while maintaining focus on what truly matters—their people and mission.
 



  





 Our culture is built on diversity, autonomy, and professionalism. We believe in the freedom of opinions and courage, fostering an environment where experiments and learning are encouraged. Our easy-going atmosphere puts life and people first, ensuring that everyone feels included and valued. We are committed to creating a truly healthy company where people enjoy their work and make a lasting impact.
 



  





*Solita is collaborating with Safemind for this recruitment.*

title: Customer Relationship Management Consultant
description:
Om rollen
 



 Leadfront växer snabbt och nu letar vi efter flera CRM Consultant att bli en del av vårt team. Vi har kunder inom både t.ex. Salesforce och HubSpot med ambition att integrera sina CX-processer och använder lösningar globalt. Vi designar, implementerar och stödjer våra kunders CRM-relaterade tjänster. Detta innebär en djupdykning i CRM lösningen och dess fulla kapacitet.
 



 ‍
 



 Arbetsuppgifter 
 


* Genomföra förstudier och inventeringar samt samarbeta med sälj för att skapa kundförslag- Sätta sig in i kundens affär och ge förslag på åtgärder som skapar affärsnytta
* Dela kunskap och ge råd om t.ex. Salesforce Sales- och Service Cloud, eller/och HubSpot bästa metoder och tillvägagångssätt till teamet och klienten
* Utveckla kort- och långsiktiga strategier för CRM och interaktioner med intressenter och angränsande system
* Skapa strategi för och leda migreringar av olika CRM-instanser
* Främja och driva CRM-användningen och hjälpa organisationen att förstå dess fördelar och hur den relaterar till de övergripande strategiska företagsmålen
* Upprätthålla en långsiktig produktkarta och strategi för att uppfylla framtida affärsbehov och kontinuerligt leta efter nya metoder för att ligga i teknikens framkant



 ‍
 



 Din bakgrund
 



 Vi hoppas att du har gedigen bakgrund och kompetens inom Salesforce eller HubSpot. Med en solid teknisk grund att stå på har du samtidigt ett starkt sinne för affärsutveckling och är duktig på att utveckla kundrelationer. Därför ser vi gärna att du de senaste åren haft en roll där affärsutveckling och kundbearbetning har stått i fokus.Vidare ser vi gärna:
 



  





 👍 Minst 4 års erfarenhet av arbete med Salesforce (eller HubSpot)
 



 👍 Erfarenhet av affärsutveckling och kundkontakt
 



 👍 Ett naturligt intresse för teknik, data och analys
 



 👍 Certifiering i Salesforce Sales/ Service cloud
 
 (eller HubSpot)
 




  





 Det är högst meriterande om du har erfarenhet av att leda transformationsprojekt som gärna har inneburit exempelvis upphandling av Marketing Automation/CRM
 



 ‍
 



 What is in it for you?
 



 Hos oss får du möjligheten till en flexibel och dynamisk roll med fast ersättning som inte är beroende av din beläggning. Du blir en del av ett energiskt och kompetent team att inspireras av och växa tillsammans med.
 



  





 Vidare förmåner:
 


* Centralt beläget kontor i Stockholm
* Stort flexibilitet (frihet under ansvar)
* Friskvårdsbidrag (5000/år)
* Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring och tjänstepension
* Intressanta uppdragsgivare (T.ex. Klarna, DNB, Svensk Fastighetsförmedling, Tieto, Telenor, Aftonbladet, MSAB m.fl)

title: Associate, Sweden
description:
Who We Are
   

  

 Boston Consulting Group partners with leaders in business and society to tackle their most important challenges and capture their greatest opportunities. BCG was the pioneer in business strategy when it was founded in 1963. Today, we help clients with total transformation-inspiring complex change, enabling organizations to grow, building competitive advantage, and driving bottom-line impact.
   

  

 To succeed, organizations must blend digital and human capabilities. Our diverse, global teams bring deep industry and functional expertise and a range of perspectives to spark change. BCG delivers solutions through leading-edge management consulting along with technology and design, corporate and digital ventures—and business purpose. We work in a uniquely collaborative model across the firm and throughout all levels of the client organization, generating results that allow our clients to thrive.
   

  

 What You'll Do
   

  

 As an Associate at BCG, you'll play a pivotal role in collaborative teams, identifying, developing, and implementing solutions for client challenges. You’ll embark on a journey of exploration and innovation, pushing the boundaries to drive impactful change.
   

  

* Collaborate in cross-functional teams to address client challenges.
* Analyze data, formulate hypotheses, and develop actionable recommendations.
* Communicate effectively with stakeholders, presenting results and driving implementation.
* Drive independent workstreams, contributing to overall project success


 What You'll Bring
   

  

* Bachelor's and master's degree (or equivalent advanced graduate degree) required.
* Strong analytical skills for quantitative problem-solving, paired with high attention to detail.
* Critical thinking skills to evaluate information, make informed decisions, and develop innovative solutions.
* Comfortable working in dynamic environments
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English. Local office language may be required.
* Ability to work collaboratively in diverse teams and adapt to changing environments.


 Additional info
   

  

**Career Development:** 
 We are committed to your growth. As an Associate, you'll receive training, coaching, and mentorship to further develop your skills and expertise. At BCG you'll have the opportunity to explore new horizons and expand your potential.
   

  

**Join Us** 
 : Ready to take the next step in your consulting career? Apply now to become an Associate at BCG and join a vibrant community of forward-thinkers and change-makers. Be part of a team that flourishes with challenge and collaboration, where your ideas are valued, and your potential is limitless. Together, let's create solutions and make a lasting impact on businesses and society.
   

  

 Boston Consulting Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity / expression, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected under national, provincial, or local law, where applicable, and those with criminal histories will be considered in a manner consistent with applicable state and local laws.
   

  

 BCG is an E - Verify Employer. Click here for more information on E-Verify.

title: IT Solution Architect
company_industry: Defense and Space Manufacturing, Security and Investigations, and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
*Vi tror att framsteg och möjligheter skapas bäst tillsammans. Välkommen till en plats där samarbete gör skillnad.*
**Din roll**
 Som IT-arkitekt hos Saab Business Area Surveillance kommer du att spela en nyckelroll i att forma framtidens IT-lösningar. Du kommer att arbeta nära affärsintressenter för att förstå deras behov och översätta dessa till robusta och effektiva IT-arkitekturer. Dina huvudsakliga uppgifter kommer att omfatta:
   

  

* Design, utveckling och dokumentation av IT-arkitekturer och lösningar med hjälp av metoder som TOGAF och modelleringsspråk som Archimate.
* Säkerställa att arkitekturerna är i linje med affärsbehov, operationella krav och övergripande IT-strategi, samtidigt som de uppfyller strikta säkerhets- och regulatoriska krav.
* Analysera befintliga IT-miljöer för att identifiera förbättringsområden och säkerställa att de möter nuvarande och framtida affärsbehov.
* Samarbeta med utvecklingsteam, IT-drift och säkerhetsfunktioner för att säkerställa framgångsrik implementering och livscykelhantering av IT-lösningar.


 Rollen innebär både inrikes- och utrikesresor.
   

  

**Din profil**
 Vi söker en analytisk och strukturerad person med en stark förmåga att lyssna och förstå affärsutmaningar. Du har en passion för att översätta dessa utmaningar till välstrukturerade IT-lösningar.
   

  

 Essentiell kompetens och erfarenhet:
   

  

* Kandidatexamen eller masterexamen inom informationsteknik, datavetenskap, systemvetenskap eller motsvarande.
* Gedigen erfarenhet av att arbeta som IT-arkitekt eller i en liknande roll med fokus på IT-infrastruktur, systemdesign och integration.
* God förståelse för och praktisk erfarenhet av arkitekturramverk som TOGAF och modelleringsspråk som Archimate.
* Erfarenhet av att designa lösningar som uppfyller strikta säkerhets- och regulatoriska krav (t.ex. inom försvars-, flyg- eller andra starkt reglerade sektorer).


 Meriterande:
   

  

* Erfarenhet av arkitekturmodelleringsverktyg, särskilt Bizzdesign.
* Kunskap om bästa praxis inom cybersäkerhet och principer för dataintegritet.


*Befattningen kräver att du genomgår och godkänns enligt vid var tid gällande bestämmelser för säkerhetsskydd. För befattningar där Saab har krav på säkerhetsklassinplacering kan, i förekommande fall, medföra krav på visst medborgarskap.*
**Vad du blir en del av**
 Bakom våra innovationer finns alla de som har gjort det möjligt. Modiga pionjärer och kluriga tänkare. Vardagshjältar och kreativa problemlösare. De som delar djup kunskap och de som utforskar nya områden. Och alla däremellan.
   

  

 Här har du chansen att påverka och bidra på ditt unika sätt. Allt från att utveckla kod och bygga imponerande försvars- och säkerhetslösningar till att ta en kaffe med en kollega. Varje bidrag räknas. Vi ger dig möjlighet att anta utmaningar och skapa smarta innovationer. I vår vänliga och tekniksmarta värld finns plats för dig att växa. Vi finns här för att tillsammans skapa trygghet för människor och samhällen.
   

  

 Saab är ett ledande försvars- och säkerhetsföretag med uppdrag att hjälpa nationer att skydda sin befolkning och bidrar till trygghet för människor och samhällen. Med 25,500 talangfulla medarbetare utvecklar Saab teknik och lösningar för en säkrare och mer hållbar värld.
   

  

 Saab utvecklar, tillverkar och underhåller avancerade system inom flygteknik, vapen, ledningssystem, sensorer och undervattenssystem. Saab har sitt huvudkontor i Sverige men en global verksamhet där Saab är en del av många nationers försvarsförmåga. Läs mer om oss här.
   

  

*Vänligen observera att vi arbetar med löpande urval och tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdatum har gått ut.*

title: Information Technology Specialist
description:
**IT-specialist med utvecklarbakgrund till Avima** 




  





 Är du en teknisk IT-specialist som vill göra verklig skillnad?
 



  





 Vi söker dig som är erfaren inom webbteknik, Windows Server, T-SQL och minst ett skript- eller kodspråk. Du har dessutom en stark teknisk profil och vana att jobba med felsökning, drift och systemintegrationer. Har du arbetat kundnära med SaaS-tjänster och vill bidra i en bransch som bokstavligen bygger samhället – då kan detta vara rollen för dig.
 



  





**Om Avima** 




  





 Tänk dig att bygga en galleria, en tunnelbanelinje eller ett nytt sjukhus – projekt som involverar tusentals människor och hundratals leverantörer. Hur håller man allt samordnat? Det är där vi på Avima kommer in.
 



  





 Vi har utvecklat en skalbar SaaS-lösning för byggbranschen, där alla dokument, beslut och all kommunikation samlas på ett och samma ställe. Resultatet? Bättre överblick, sparad tid och minskad risk för förseningar och slöseri.
 



  





 Med funktioner som dokumenthantering och kanban-tavlor är vi unika och ledande inom vår nisch. Vi har redan omkring 70 000 användare och kunder som Westfield, Stockholm Stad och Holmen.
 



  





 Sedan hösten 2024 är vi en del av
 **iBinder Group** 
 – något som ytterligare stärker vår position och våra möjligheter att göra skillnad!
 



  





**Din roll** 




  





 Som IT-specialist hos oss arbetar du tekniskt på djupet med vår SaaS-plattform och kundernas tekniska utmaningar kopplat till den, i nära samarbete med produkt- och utvecklingsteamet. Detta är en roll för dig som trivs i teknisk felsökning och har stark förståelse för webbdrift, SQL och servermiljöer. Du blir en nyckelperson i 3:e linjens support och hanterar våra driftsmiljöer tillsammans med driftspartners. Du hjälper kunder med integrationer och uppsättningar samt bidrar till felsökning och förbättringar av plattformen. Om du dessutom brinner för utveckling och vill växa inom detta område, erbjuder vi en miljö där du får växa, utmanas och göra verklig skillnad.
 



  





**Ansvarsområden** 




  




* 3:e linjens teknisk produktsupport tillsammans med vårt utvecklingsteam
* Teknisk rådgivning och kring kundintegrationer
* SQL-skriptning för felsökning och dataexport
* Felsökning av webbtjänsten
* Automatiserade och manuella uppgraderingar
* Serverkonfiguration och driftshantering
* Kundkontakt relaterad till support och införanden
* Återkommande driftsrelaterat arbete med partners



  





**Kvalifikationer** 




  




* >5 års erfarenhet av kvalificerad support för webbsystem
* 1–3 års erfarenhet av SQL-skriptning
* Djup kunskap inom Windows Server och IIS
* Gedigen erfarenhet av minst ett skript- eller kodspråk (t.ex. C#, Python eller PowerShell)
* Goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska



  





**Meriterande** 




  




* Prestandaoptimering i SQL Server
* Kunskaper inom DevOps (t.ex. Octopus Deploy, TeamCity)
* Erfarenhet av REST-tjänster och integrationer (OAuth 2, SAML 2.0)
* Förståelse för nätverk och IT-infrastruktur
* Bakgrund inom produktutveckling och produktdesign



  





**Personliga egenskaper** 




  




* Problemlösare med starkt driv
* Ansvarstagande och strukturerad
* Kommunikativ och samarbetsvillig
* Flexibel och tekniskt bred
* Bosatt i Stockholm och trivs med distribuerat arbete



  





**Varför iBinder Group?** 




  





 🌍
 **Meningsfullt arbete i ett tryggt bolag** 
 – Hos oss får du både stabiliteten från en etablerad organisation och pulsen från en tech-driven tillväxtresa inom en spännande bransch.
 



  





 💻
 **Modern teknik och spännande projekt** 
 – Du arbetar i en modern teknisk miljö och får vara med och vidareutveckla en plattform som påverkar hela bygg- och fastighetsbranschen.
 



  





 📈
 **Utrymme att växa** 
 – Vi erbjuder personlig och professionell utveckling och ger dig möjlighet att ta nästa steg i din karriär.
 



  





 🤝
 **En kultur att trivas i** 
 – Vi är certifierade som ett
 *Great Place to Work* 
 och har ett högt eNPS inom vårt Product & Engineering-team. Här jobbar du i ett team med hög tillit, härlig stämning och starkt samarbete.
 



  





 📍 Plats: Stockholm / Hybrid
 



  





 Välkommen med din ansökan! 🚀

title: Test Manager
description:
**Job Title: Test Manager** 




**Location: Gothenburg / Stockholm, Sweden (Hybrid)** 




**Job Type: Contract (B2B) /Fixed Term Contract (1 year)** 




  





 Key Responsibilities:
 



  





  Plan and monitor the test activities for the stream (Internal/external).
 



  Execute predefined testing, including API testing and other critical validation
 



 processes.
 



  Utilize Jira/XRAY and Confluence for documentation, tracking, and collaboration.
 



  Ensure proactive test planning and execution, maintaining high quality across
 



 deliverables.
 



  Coordinate test activities between assigned project and other streams/project for
 



 seamless integration.
 



  Act as a strategic advisor on testing best practices and quality assurance.
 



  





 Qualifications:
 



  





  Proven experience in technical test management methodologies.
 



  Experience in API and Network (Radius/Roaming) testing, and troubleshooting
 



 experience in telecom/NW.
 



  Experience with Wireshark and osix tools can be an advantage.
 



  Knowledge in telecom technologies like Radio Access Network (RAN), Mobile
 



 Core (4G, 5G, 5GNSA) are highly appreciated.
 



  Strong hands-on expertise in Jira and Confluence for test management.
 



  Excellent communication and leadership skills to drive alignment across
 



 stakeholders.
 



  Highly proactive and organized, with the ability to manage multiple priorities
 



 effectively.
 



  Right mindset is equally important as technical skill. A problem-solving attitude,
 



 analytical thinking, and the ability to thrive under pressure in a fast-moving
 



 landscape is a must for success.

title: Operations Associate - Stockholm
description:
Come and build something monumental for Healthcare!
   

  

 At Tandem Health we’re reimagining healthcare by putting clinicians first. Our platform - designed by clinicians, for clinicians - is built on deep insight into real-world pain points, with intuitive medical notes and workflows that truly support patient care.
   

  

 We’re a fast-scaling health-tech company backed by top investors and expanding globally. We move fast, stay curious, and believe building something that matters starts with an extraordinary team. If you're passionate about impact and innovation, we'd love to meet you!
   

  

***Please Note:** 
 Applications will close EOD June 16th. We will not review applications until this date so take your time to apply - you don't have to be first and all applications will be reviewed!*
**About The Role**
 We are looking for an exceptional individual eager to play a vital role in how Tandem operate as we scale from a startup to global player. As our first operations-only hire, you’ll pair up with our Chief of Staff and CEO to shape the operational engine of the company – helping turn strategy into execution across markets and teams.
   

  

 You’ll be at the center of how things get done, from tightening the gears of daily operations to driving special projects and company-wide initiatives forward. You will be pivotal in helping us move faster, smarter, and with more intention, while carving out space to grow into a domain of operations that excites you over time.
   

  

 This is a unique opportunity to gain broad exposure to the full scope of one of Europe’s fastest-growing tech companies. If you’re sharp, always ten steps ahead, and just love making things happen, this role is for you!
   

  

 What You will Do
   

  

* Be a force multiplier for the Chief of Staff to drive strategic and operational initiatives across the company
* Independently execute on day-to-day ops, as well as high-impact special projects across teams and markets over time (think: market launches, partnership rollouts, internal process improvements)
* Help plan and coordinate internal and external events – including key gatherings that shape how we work together, conferences, and other instances where our team will need to shine
* Build and shape processes that define our operational engine across all corners of the business
* Collaborating with Talent, Expansion, Finance, and Legal on cross-functional work
* Conduct research, prepare briefings, or coordinate with vendors and partners - whatever it takes to get the job done


 What You Bring
   

  

* Some experience working in a fast-paced environment; consulting, tech, health-tech, or early-stage startups ideally
* Or: a recent graduate with standout internship or work experience and a drive to jump into operations head-first, learning as you go with a ‘everything is solvable’ mindset
* Strong business sense: you get how companies work, what makes them run, and where to step in to move things forward
* Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail - you love keeping things tidy and efficient
* A bias for action: you’re self-directed, resourceful, and comfortable figuring things out
* Clear and confident communicator, both written and verbal


 Bonus Points
   

  

* Experience supporting senior leaders or executives
* Exposure to healthcare, tech, or highly regulated industries
* Event planning or logistics coordination experience
* You’ve worked across multiple teams or functions before - and loved it


 Location
   

  

 We believe the best ideas happen when we’re together. This role is based in our vibrant HQ in the Epicenter building in the heart of Stockholm where you will work primarily from our office to collaborate, connect, and build our culture.
   

  

 How to Apply
   

  

 We will consider applications until
 **EOD on June 16th 2025** 
 , so please make sure to apply with your CV in English before then. Applications will be reviewed thereafter.
   

  

 Our interview process consists of 4 stages:
   

  

* Screening interview with Talent Acquisition
* First interview with our Chief of Staff
* Follow up interview with our CEO and Co-Founder
* Working Day - Join us in the Stockholm office for a day to experience our culture firsthand, collaborate with our team, and see how you work in action.


**Benefits**
* Competitive salary & company stock options
* 25 days/year of paid vacation
* 5,000 SEK wellness allowance (friskvårdsbidrag)
* Social and team-building activities (off-sites, after works, winter/summer parties)
* An opportunity to make a real positive impact in the world of healthcare
* Work with some of the best minds in AI, healthcare, and engineering.


*We review our benefits packages on a regular basis and might modify our benefits from time to time.*
 Culture at Tandem
   

  

 At Tandem, we move fast, think big, and take ownership. We're a high-performing, diverse team with a shared drive to change the future of healthcare - and we’re just getting started.
   

  

 Our culture is built on action, ambition, and learning. You'll be trusted to take the lead, challenge yourself, and make an impact from day one. We believe real growth happens when you're stretched, supported, and surrounded by smart, passionate teammates who want to win together.
   

  

 Even though we’re spread across countries, we come together often in Sweden for team meetings, social events, and offsites - blending global reach with real human connection.
   

  

 We hire for talent, potential, and attitude - valuing different backgrounds and fresh perspectives. Great ideas come from everywhere, and we’re building a team that reflects the world we want to change.

title: Kvalitets- och testansvarig
description:
Vi söker dig som vill arbeta med testledning och kvalitetsansvar för vår mjukvara Advantum. Du kommer att vara ansvarig såväl för vårt kvalitetsarbete som vår testledning. Advantum är ett unikt dokumenthanteringssystem och är sedan starten framtaget i nära samarbete med ledande företag inom svensk industri. InfoTech utvecklar, supportar, marknadsför och säljer Advantum och tar även helhetsansvar för såväl installation, support, utbildning och kundunika konfigureringar. Advantum används inom en rad olika branscher inklusive Life Science med höga regulatoriska krav.
 



 För att trivas i rollen har du ett teknikintresse och förstår logiska samband mellan utveckling, kvalitetsarbete, test och testledning. Du har även ett affärsorienterat synsätt och kan guida våra kunder genom en audit likväl som att du förstår vikten av att vi levererar lösningar med hög kvalitet vid leveranser. Det är viktigt att du är en “doer” som ser till att saker och ting blir gjorda.
 



  





**Ansvar och arbetsuppgifter** 




 Du vill vara delaktig i och ansvara för att kvalitetssäkra framtidens Advantum med moderna metoder och deltar gärna internt för att driva vår verksamhet och utveckling framåt. Framåt ligger även planer på en ISO-certifiering och du kommer att vara en viktig kugge i arbetet med att få detta på plats. Du arbetar tätt med vårt utvecklingsteam för att säkerställa att vi levererar med utmärkt kvalitet. Det är också väsentligt att våra anställda har en affärsmässighet mot kund.
 



  





**Exempel på arbetsuppgifter:** 



* Ansvara för och leda det interna kvalitetsarbetet
* Skapa och underhålla dokumentation och manualer kopplat till vår produkt Advantum.
* Skapa och underhålla dokumentation kopplat till vårt kvalitetsarbete.
* Se till att vårt kvalitetssystem håller en hög nivå och att det underhålls löpande.
* Förbereda och leda kundaudits samt återkommande interna kvalitetsuppgifter.
* Arbeta med test och kvalitetssäkring på vår utvecklingsavdelning.
* Leda vårt testarbete genom planering och framtagande av teststrategier.
* Skriva och exekvera manuella testfall.
* Bidra i diskussioner om kvalitetssäkring och agila metoder.· Vara med och driva kvalitetsarbetet framåt och
* framtidssäkra både på strategisk och operativ nivå. Bland annat genom ISO-certifiering.
* Vara med och forma vår interna kultur och vår utveckling.



  





**Kvalifikationer** 




**Erfarenhet och kompetenskrav** 



* Har minst 5 års erfarenhet inom test och testledning inom IT.
* Har minst 5 års erfarenhet inom kvalitetsarbete och helst kvalitetsansvar.
* Bred kunskap om testmetodik och vertygsstöd inom test.
* Van att arbeta självständigt med framtagande och underhåll av dokumentation kopplad till kvalitetsarbete.
* Flytande Svenska och Engelska i tal och skrift.



  





**Du som person** 



* Är en lagspelare och god kollega.
* Är noggrann och mån om att leva upp till kvalitetsstandard.
* Vill utvecklas ännu mer inom test och kvalitet.
* Är självgående, ansvarstagande, nyfiken och har en vilja att utvecklas.



  





**Meriterande erfarenheter och kunskaper** 



* Erfarenhet av Azure Devops och GIT.
* Erfarenhet från Contiunous Integration/Deployment och DevOps.
* Kunskap om agila metoder.
* Erfarenhet av kvalitetsarbete inom regulatoriska branscher.
* ISTQB-certifiering



  





**Vi erbjuder dig** 




 Vi erbjuder en platt organisation i en prestigelös miljö med korta beslutsvägar. Kollegor med gedigen kunskap om vår plattform och affärer, en stor portion nyfikenhet, kreativitet och engagemang. Ett agilt arbetssätt, möjlighet att påverka och fatta egna beslut samtidigt med hög trygghet från kollegor och samarbetspartners. Vi tror på kraften i våra medarbetare och på att ta tillvara olika individers unika styrkor.
 


* Marknadsmässig lön
* Bra förmånspaket
* Flexibel arbetsmiljö
* Heltid
* Tillträde enligt överenskommelse



**Placeringsort:** 
 Stockholm, Kungsholmen
 



  





 Kontakta Fredrik Nilsson, 070-236 30 68, fredrik.nilsson@infotech.se, för mer information om tjänsten och ansökan. Vi undanber oss vänligen men bestämt kontakt från rekryteringsföretag då vi har vår egen rekryteringsprocess.

title: Social Media Manager to H&M BEAUTY
description:
**Job Description**
**H&M BEAUTY** 
 is capturing the enormous potential of the beauty market by becoming the world's most fashionable beauty destination. On this journey, we have reimagined our makeup line, continuously elevating our private label assortment to include makeup, beauty tools, body care, and fragrance. We also focus on building a credible and complete beauty destination by complementing our in-house offerings with the latest external beauty brands, enabling our customers to complement their fashion looks with top beauty products.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
 As our Social Media Manager, you will have responsibility for running, developing, and extending our social media channels for both paid and organic channels. You will lead the work together with our paid media agency and set strategies together for building brand awareness and performance, as well as activate our paid social campaigns. You will be an essential part of the Marketing team at H&M Beauty, work close with a social media & content specialist and report to Head of Marketing at H&M Beauty.
   

  

**Key responsibilities:**
* Build and execute social media strategies with the objective of growing channels, engagement and ultimately drive new sales for the business
* Collaborate with influencer marketing, PR and assortment for content and campaign development that align with overall brand goals
* Secure platform specific content, for both paid and organic social, adapted for each platform and our audiences
* Optimize and establish best practice for H&M Beauty on each platform
* Responsible for planning engaging content in our channels
* Measure and analyze impact of social media initiatives on various KPIs to learn and improve
* Stay up to date with the evolving landscape and bring forth ideas to stay competitive within social media.


**Who You Are**
***We are looking for people with…***
* Documented experience (+3 years) working with paid and organic social media, developing and managing strategies to grow social media audiences and ultimately drive new sales for the business at an agency or in-house team
* Ability to drive our social media channels both when it comes to content, interaction with our community, development and ways of working with other functions in our organization
* A proven capacity to manage engaging content for key social media channels such as Meta and TikTok
* Ability and experience in working with social media analytics tools and to develop marketing strategies based on findings
* Excellent communication skills in English, both written and spoken


***And people who are…***
  

  

* Genuine interest in the beauty industry and preferably have experience within retail industry
* Highly motivated problem-solver and a self-starter; capable of working independently, yet collaboratively, within a fast-paced environment
* Entrepreneurial and thrive working in a small organization where you can work high and low with the objective to grow with us as a brand.


**Who We Are**
 H&M Group is a global company of strong fashion brands and ventures. Our goal is to prove that there is no compromise between exceptional design, affordable prices, and sustainable solutions. We want to liberate fashion for the many, and our customers are at the heart of every decision we make.
   

  

 We are made up of thousands of passionate and talented colleagues united by our shared culture and values. Together, we want to use our power, our scale, and our knowledge to push the fashion industry towards a more inclusive and sustainable future.
   

  

**WHY YOU’LL LOVE WORKING HERE** 
  

  

 At H&M Group, we are proud to be a vibrant and welcoming company. We offer our employees attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe.
   

  

* 25% Staff discount on all our H&M Group brands, both in stores and online (H&M, COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories and ARKET).
* H&M Incentive Program – HIP. Learn more about the program here.
* In addition to our global benefits, our local markets offer different competitive perks and benefits. (Example: Competitive compensation for your dedication and long-term commitment. A day off on your birthday to relax and celebrate your special day. Special gift to celebrate the birth of your child, etc.)


**JOIN US**
 Our uniqueness comes from a combination of many things – our inclusive and collaborative culture, our strong values, and opportunities for growth. But most of all, it’s our people who make us who we are.
   

  

 Take the next step in your career together with us. The journey starts here.  This is a
 **1,5-year temporary position** 
 based in Stockholm, please send your CV in English as soon as possible but by the latest, 8th of June 2025.

title: Technology Governance Specialist
description:
**Bakgrund**
 Funktionen har i uppgift att utifrån ett första linje-perspektiv stödja Technology Governance inom styrning, regelefterlevnad, internkontroll och processer.
   

  

 Ditt och dina kollegors ansvar är att säkerställa att IT-verksamheten styrs på ett adekvat sätt och att den bedrivs i enlighet med rådande regelverk. Du stödjer verksamheten ur ett första linje-perspektiv inom styrning och regelefterlevnad.
   

  

**Erfarenhet**
* Vi söker dig som har arbetat i minst fem år inom områdena styrning, intern kontroll och/eller compliance rörande IT verksamhet inom finansiell sektor (under Finansinspektionens tillsyn).
* Du kan ha skaffat dig din erfarenhet från bank och/eller försäkring eller annan reglerad verksamhet liksom från revisions- eller konsultbolag med fokus på styrning och regelefterlevnad inom IT.
* Vi ser det som meriterande med erfarenhet av att leda projekt, driva förändring och utveckling i projektform och tycker att det är bra om du har förståelse och helst goda kunskaper om för vår kunds relevanta regelverk, riktlinjer och standarder från EBA, Riksbanken och Finansinspektionen.
* Du har relevant akademisk examen


**Exempel På Uppgifter Som Ingår i Tjänsten**
* Upprätthålla ramverket för styrning inom IT-organisationen samt säkerställa att detta följer kundens övergripande principer och strategier för styrning
* Säkerställa ändamålsenlig styrning inom IT genom att tillse att policyer, riktlinjer och instruktioner är ändamålsenligt utformade, korrekt implementerade och inkorporerar tillämpliga regelverkskrav
* Stödja verksamheten i att uppdatera och utveckla styrdokument
* Stödja IT-organisationen i att implementera nya och förändrade regelverk
* Hålla kontinuerlig översikt över pågående införanden av regelverk
* Stödja externa och interna revisioner och granskningar relaterade till regelefterlevnad inom IT


 Förutom ett nära samarbete med IT-verksamheten har du även mycket kontakt med andra delar i kundens organisation såsom Compliance- och Juridik.
   

  

**Personliga egenskaper**
 Du analyserar situationer och förutser problem, utvecklar effektiva, förnuftiga och genomförbara lösningar på problem. Ser till helheten och prioriterar utifrån övergripande strategier.
   

  

 Du är handlingskraftig och initierar på egen hand aktiviteter och projekt. Söker självständigt upp nya utmaningar inom arbetet och agerar när andra tvekar.
   

  

 Du är målfokuserad och har en god förmåga att hantera motgång och är entusiastisk och positiv även i tuffa situationer. Du ändrar snabbt ditt beteende för att anpassa dig till nya omständigheter och arbetar konstruktivt under press, stress och vid misslyckanden.
   

  

 Som person är du strukturerad och tar fram planer som är övergripande och realistiska och integrerar kort- och långsiktiga mål med helhetsbilden.
   

  

 Du är kommunikativt säker och förmedlar information tydligt och enkelt, både muntligt och skriftligt.
   

  

**Omfattning:** 
 100%
   

  

**Tillträde:** 
 Omgående eller enligt överenskommelse.
   

  

**Slutdatum:** 
 till och med minst 2025-12-31 med option om förlängning.
   

  

**Placering:** 
 Stockholm Liljeholmen

title: E-Commerce & Customer Experience Manager
description:
This is a part-time role (approx. 50-80%), with the possibility of expansion to a full-time position. It’s a varied and evolving opportunity, best suited to someone highly efficient and comfortable prioritising tasks across various areas, including website operations, customer support, and email marketing. We’re open to shaping the scope of the role around the right candidate’s strengths and experience.
 



  





**About the Role** 




  





 We are seeking an
 **E-Commerce & Customer Experience Manager** 
 to drive our online store operations, website performance, customer support, and email marketing. This role is key to ensuring a seamless and optimised shopping journey, from product discovery through post-purchase engagement. The ideal candidate has experience in e-commerce, digital marketing, or customer service, understands conversion optimisation, and can leverage data to build and enhance both our e-commerce and customer experience strategies. This is an exciting opportunity to join a growing premium skiwear start-up where you’ll have the chance to shape systems from the ground up. You’ll be part of a small, passionate team working in a dynamic, creative environment in the heart of Södermalm.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities** 




  





**E-Commerce & Website Management (Shopify)** 



* Own the day-to-day management of our online store, ensuring a smooth and engaging customer journey.
* Work closely with our developer to implement new features, troubleshoot issues, and optimise site performance.
* Handle product uploads, pricing updates, and content updates.
* Monitor analytics and propose improvements to increase conversion rates and AOV.



  





**Customer Experience & Returns (Yayloh)** 



* Manage and streamline the returns process to ensure efficiency and customer satisfaction.
* Respond to customer inquiries via email, maintaining high service levels.
* Create and maintain automated processes for FAQs, returns, and order tracking.
* Identify areas to enhance the overall customer journey.



  





**Email Marketing & CRM (Klaviyo)** 



* Manage ENNUE’s email marketing - scheduling and optimising campaigns, and reporting on performance.
* Develop automated flows (welcome series, abandoned cart, post-purchase, etc.).
* Segment customers for targeted marketing and personalisation.
* Track email performance and continuously optimise for engagement and conversions.



  





**About you** 



* 2+ years of experience in e-commerce, digital marketing, or customer service.
* Familiarity with Shopify, Klaviyo, or similar.
* A proactive self-starter who thrives in a fast-paced environment.
* A collaborative team player with an eye for detail and quality.
* Strong organisational and problem-solving skills with a focus on optimising processes.
* Comfortable working independently and across teams, with a positive and adaptable mindset.
* Interest in fashion, sports, or outdoor industries is a plus.



  






 Applications must be submitted in
 
**English** 

 and include a
 
**CV** 

 and
 
**cover letter** 

 . As we will be interviewing candidates on a rolling basis, we encourage you to apply at your earliest convenience.

title: Global Media Manager (Interim)
description:
**GANT stands as an emblem of American Sportswear, symbolizing timeless style and innovation across 70+ global markets. As a company, we blend heritage with contemporary flair, crafting apparel for the bold, the curious, and the imaginative. Our brand represents more than fashion; it's a tradition of excellence and authenticity. As an employer, we foster a culture of continuous learning and creativity, inviting high performers to join our diverse team of innovators. At GANT, we're not just shaping the future of fashion; we're redefining what it means to dress with purpose and passion.** 




  





**About the role** 




 Are you a strategic media expert with a passion for driving brand impact across global markets? Join GANT as Interim Global Media Manager and take the lead in shaping our paid media strategy across both digital and offline channels.
 



  





 This interim position, based at our HQ in Stockholm, runs through February 2026 and offers the opportunity to work at the heart of a dynamic, international brand.
 



  





 We are now looking for a Global Media Manager for an interim assignment until approximately February 2026. In this role, you will be responsible for developing and implementing GANT's global media strategy across all paid online and offline media channels. You will ensure strategic alignment between brand objectives and media investments, working closely with the Online Marketing team for digital execution and managing offline media buying and media partnerships in-house. This is a key position in enhancing marketing efficiency and brand visibility through smart, data-driven media choices.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities** 



* Develop and execute GANT's global media strategy across paid digital and offline channels, ensuring alignment with brand and business objectives.
* Define and continuously refine strategic media target groups to optimize campaign relevance and reach.
* Manage offline media buying (print, OOH) and negotiate global media partnerships to maximize ROI and brand visibility.
* Collaborate closely with the Online Marketing team and external media agencies to ensure seamless and high-quality campaign execution.
* Analyze media performance data and provide insights to optimize strategies, campaign efficiency, and budget allocation.
* Deliver media input for creative briefs and guide execution to ensure impactful, on-brand communication across channels.
* Act as GANT's internal media expert-advising stakeholders, ensuring compliance, and staying ahead of media trends and best practices.



  





**Profile** 



* At least 8 years of experience in media strategy and execution, preferably within fashion, lifestyle, or consumer goods industries.
* In-depth knowledge of both paid digital media (social, programmatic, display, search) and traditional offline media buying.
* Proven track record of managing large-scale, global media campaigns and high-level media partnerships.
* Strong analytical mindset with the ability to turn performance data into actionable insights.
* Skilled negotiator with experience collaborating with media agencies and vendors.
* Excellent cross-functional collaboration skills, working effectively with creative, e-commerce, and regional teams.
* Proficient in media measurement tools, attribution modeling, and audience targeting techniques.
* Strong project and time management skills, with the ability to lead multiple campaigns in a fast-paced environment.



  





 Apply with your CV in English by 2025/06/30. Our team reviews applications on a rolling basis, so seize the opportunity to join us by submitting your application today! Please note that this position may be filled before the set end date.

title: Global Contingent Workforce Partner
description:
**About Sinch**
 Sinch is pioneering the way the world communicates. More than 150,000 businesses — including Google, Uber, Paypal, Visa, Tinder, and many others — rely on Sinch's Customer Communications Cloud to power engaging customer experiences through mobile messaging, voice, and email.
   

  

 Whether you need to verify users or craft omnichannel campaigns, Sinch makes it easy. Our AI-infused Super Network, APIs, and applications ensure you can connect with your customers reliably and securely, at every step of their journey.
   

  

 At Sinch we "Dream Big", "Win Together", "Keep it simple", and "Make it Happen". These values are our foundation!
   

  

**Description**
 We are looking for a Contingent Workforce Partner to oversee the end-to-end process for our contingent workforce and shape the future of contingent workforce management at Sinch.
   

  

 The ideal candidate has experience in contingent workforce management, vendor relations, and workforce operations. The role will be located in Stockholm and will report to Head of Talent Acquisition EMEA & APAC.
   

  

**Some of your key responsibilities will be;**
* Manage the full lifecycle of contingent workers (requests, contracts, extensions, payments). You will be the primary person to handle operations in EMEA. In APAC and US, you will have support in local execution.
* Act as the primary contact and advisor for the business as well as HR in questions relating to contingent workforce.
* Manage relationships with external vendors, staffing agencies, and system providers ensuring service quality and cost-effectiveness.
* Own and refine the roadmap for contingent workforce strategy, ensuring alignment with business needs.
* Identify and implement process improvements to enhance operational efficiency.
* Enablement of key metrics reporting and insights for informed decision-making.


**Requirements**
* Experience in contingent workforce management, HR operations, procurement, or vendor management.
* Experience with Vendor Management Systems (VMS) or HRIS platforms.
* Strong stakeholder management and communication skills.
* Strong analytical skills and strategic problem solver with experience in data-driven decision-making.
* Knowledge of workforce compliance, contracts, and procurement processes.
* Experience in global or multi-country workforce management. Experience from the US market is an extra bonus!
* Familiarity with labor laws and regulations related to contingent workforce engagement.


**OUR HIRING PROCESS**
 We are committed to ensuring a recruitment process that is fair, objective, consistent, and inclusive. Our approach includes structured, competency-based interviews designed to evaluate your skills, experience, and qualifications relevant to the role. At times, we may include a data-driven assessment to enhance our hiring success and identify candidates likely to excel.
   

  

 We believe in a two-way process and encourage you to ask questions throughout the journey. If this role isn't what you're looking for, please explore the other opportunities listed on our career page: https://www.sinch.com/careers/. No matter who you are, we hope you find an exciting path forward - hopefully with us!

title: First Line Support Manager within eHealth
description:
Cambio is one of the Nordics' leading suppliers in e-health with a comprehensive offering for the entire health and care chain. Our e-health solutions support healthcare professionals in their daily work and offer patients safer and more easily accessible care. We are proud to be an important part of Swedish health and social care. We are growing continuously and now have about 1000 employees in several countries.
   

  

**The position**
 The Team Manager for first line Customer support is responsible for operating and running Cambio’s first line support. Cambio’s Customer support is our strategic touch points with our customers, and your goal is to ensure a continuous service excellence performance where we are learning from each customer interaction.
   

  

 You will be part of owning the way of working for the area, tools, and to secure an effective governance to secure high-quality and efficient deliveries from the team.
   

  

 Cambio’s primary objective is to deliver a high-quality customer experience, and your future team play a critical role in delivering against our customer contracts, needs, and expectations.
   

  

 You will report to the Head of Customer Support and you will apply improvement strategies developed in conjunction with major stakeholders from the Customer Delivery Division and deliver operational outputs to both our customers and internal stakeholders.
   

  

 This role gives you the unique opportunity to be a part of an upscaling 24/7 support function within health care industries. You will join in a time where you will take an active part in the upscaling process including recruiting your own team, defining, setting internal KPIs/PIs and managing an outsourced partner for a part of first line support.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Provide tactical and operational direction for our customer support team to continually deliver on our customer experience, cost management and SLAs.
* Maintain and improve our customer support tactical plans with focus on organization, processes and tools, and capability development.
* Maintain an active role in hiring, training, workforce planning, and supporting the team, as well as managing all day-to-day team activities
* Identify, implement, and drive continuous improvement projects within your area
* Establish and improve monitoring procedures and KPI dashboard
* Set and monitor operations to ensure adherence to schedules, work plans, and performance requirements


 At Cambio, we encourage taking initiatives that contribute to the development of the company and ourselves. For us, it is important that you should have the opportunity to grow, both as a person and as an employee. Our culture is described through the words “Trust”, “Care” and “Together” which permeate everything we do.
   

  

**About You**
 You have proven leadership experience, ideally from a customer support environment. You enjoy leading, motivating, and coaching teams. You have a passion for your team members personal development. Identifying improvements, solving problems under pressure and adapt to frequently changing work needs to motivate and drive you. You should always think about how to enhance the customer experience for continuous service excellence.
   

  

**Requirements** 
  

  

* At least 3 years of experience in a contact center management role or equivalent university degree, preferable in business and/or management.
* Proven track record in managing multiple projects, competing priorities, and deadlines
* Experience of performance management and operational work force planning management
* Solid understanding of ITIL processes, ITSM tools and good understanding of contact center tools infrastructure (including integrations)
* Analytical, able to analyze contact center reporting, and data to make decisions to support corporate, regulatory, and customer service-level goals
* Fluent in Swedish and English, both written and spoken


**It's a bonus if you**
* Experience of knowledge management and KCS
* Experience of managing larger teams


**Place of employment** 
 : Stockholm
   

  

 At Cambio we value a healthy work-life balance, and to encourage that we apply a hybrid working-model. Together with your team you decide which days you work at the office. On the remaining days you can work remotely from home, but you are always more than welcome to work at the office too.
   

  

**Scope** 
 : Full time
   

  

**Form of employment:** 
 Permanent employment, 6 months trial period
   

  

**Other:** 
 We screen the applications and hold interviews continuously so please send your application as soon as possible via the link.
   

  

 We encourage and eagerly welcome all applications, but we will only consider candidates who are located and have the legal right to work in Sweden
 **.** 
 We will ask for verification during the process.
   

  

**We look forward to receiving your application!**
 Read more about us
 **here!**
 Are you interested in Cambio but you don’t feel that this position is the perfect match? Check out our other open positions at the career site
 **here!**
 Cambio Healthcare Systems is Sweden’s leading suppliers of healthcare information systems and a growing player in the European market with just over 100,000 users across general and university hospitals, specialist units and outpatient units. Through the use of our integrated solutions, our customers provide services to 4 million patients.

title: Customer Success Partner Senior Advisor
company_industry: Software Development, IT Services and IT Consulting, and Business Consulting and Services
description:
**We help the world run better**
 At SAP, we enable you to bring out your best. Our company culture is focused on collaboration and a shared passion to help the world run better. How? We focus every day on building the foundation for tomorrow and creating a workplace that embraces differences, values flexibility, and is aligned to our purpose-driven and future-focused work. We offer a highly collaborative, caring team environment with a strong focus on learning and development, recognition for your individual contributions, and a variety of benefit options for you to choose from.
   

  

**Summary**
 The SAP Business Technology Platform (SAP BTP) is a technology platform that brings together data and analytics, artificial intelligence, application development, automation, and integration in one, unified environment. BTP is one of the highest profile and fastest growing parts of the SAP portfolio and critical to SAP helping our customers innovate and grow with SAP. In EMEA alone BTP represents a 1BN Euro business supporting > 8,000 customers. Aside from being the foundation for SAP applications it provides a modern platform of cloud capabilities to enables customers to extend, enhance and innovate above and beyond their existing applications.
   

  

 The focus of this position is to join the BTP Customer Success Partner (CSP) team and become the trusted advisor to some of our flagship EMEA customers, helping them drive a roadmap for BTP adoption and consumption across their organization.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* You will proactively partner with customers to sustainably increase consumption of SAP BTP services, and coordinate activities with the Account Team, by building out a joint outcome-based Adoption plan, and drive a mutual understanding of IT-Architecture and Business value.
* You understand the big picture, deliver expertise with digital transformation across different lines of business, advise on technical and business architectures.
* You are the primary SAP BTP strategic point of contact and will orchestrate success resources across SAP and customers, leveraging assets of the SAP BTP engagement model.
* You will analyze your customer’s Vision, Technical needs and execute consumption plans for your assigned customers.
* You will instruct and prepare the customer to make the best use of the solution, in alignment with SAP strategy and roadmap.
* You will be a voice of the customer to internal SAP stakeholders. You will work with colleagues from a broad variety of groups such as Cloud Success Services life-cycle relevant centers of experts, Account Teams, Pre-sales, Product Management groups, Support, Services, Partners, etc.
* BTP-CSP Senior Advisor may also be assigned to fulfill a customer’s premium subscription services.


**Role Requirements**
 You will excel in this role if you:
   

  

* Have 5-6 years of experience working in the IT Industry in Customer facing roles. Your background could be Software Engineering, Solution Management, Project/Product Management, Project Implementation, Pre-sales, Technical Customer Engagement, Customer Success, Proactive Support Services, Consulting, etc.
* Have excellent understanding of one or more areas of the SAP BTP portfolio: SAP Business Technology Platform , SAP Business Data Cloud covering Datasphere , SAP Analytics Cloud.


 Extension and Integration Suite, Cloud Databases .
   

  

* Have a working knowledge of hybrid and cloud-based landscapes and can guide customers on Solution Advisory , Cloud Strategies and Architecture guidance.
* Certifications in Business Technology Platform or Enterprise architecture are a plus.
* Have foundational knowledge of public cloud platforms and providers (e.g. Microsoft
* Azure, Amazon Web Services, Google Cloud, etc.)
* Have professional experience with implementing cloud initiatives.
* Have excellent communication and presentation skills. Familiarity with design thinking methodology is a plus.
* Communicate proactively and can prioritize efficiently. You have a strong sense of accountability.
* Can manage complex organizational dynamics both internally at SAP, as well as externally with customers and partners.
* Can continuously learn and adapt to the unique business and cultural practices of each region/country.
* Have a strong customer service mindset and customer empathy.
* Have a passion for learning new technologies and enjoy problem solving.
* Thrive in a dynamic team-based environment and can guide new team members into the role.


**Other Requirements**
* Fluent in both English and Swedish
* Already situated in Sweden, as relocation is not supported for this position


**Our Team**
 We pride on a work environment that is inclusive and diverse. Every idea and perspective are valued.
   

  

 The SAP Business Technology Platform CSP team is committed to sustain each other to ensure success, both individually and as a team. We have a pay it forward mentality and are always willing to help our colleagues. Our culture is built upon sharing best practices, utilizing communication platforms to answer each other’s questions, and bringing an entrepreneurial
   

  

 spirit to the mission of driving SAP BTP consumption growth together. We provide opportunities to lead regional and global workstreams that help us improve as a team and contribute to great customer experiences
   

  

**Bring out your best**
 SAP innovations help more than four hundred thousand customers worldwide work together more efficiently and use business insight more effectively. Originally known for leadership in enterprise resource planning (ERP) software, SAP has evolved to become a market leader in end-to-end business application software and related services for database, analytics, intelligent technologies, and experience management. As a cloud company with two hundred million users and more than one hundred thousand employees worldwide, we are purpose-driven and future-focused, with a highly collaborative team ethic and commitment to personal development. Whether connecting global industries, people, or platforms, we help ensure every challenge gets the solution it deserves. At SAP, you can bring out your best.
   

  

**We win with inclusion**
 SAP’s culture of inclusion, focus on health and well-being, and flexible working models help ensure that everyone – regardless of background – feels included and can run at their best. At SAP, we believe we are made stronger by the unique capabilities and qualities that each person brings to our company, and we invest in our employees to inspire confidence and help everyone realize their full potential. We ultimately believe in unleashing all talent and creating a better and more equitable world.
   

  

 SAP is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to the values of Equal Employment Opportunity and provide accessibility accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are interested in applying for employment with SAP and are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to Recruiting Operations Team: Careers@sap.com
   

  

 For SAP employees: Only permanent roles are eligible for the SAP Employee Referral Program, according to the eligibility rules set in the SAP Referral Policy. Specific conditions may apply for roles in Vocational Training.
   

  

**EOE AA M/F/Vet/Disability**
 Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their age, race, religion, national origin, ethnicity, age, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, et al), sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, protected veteran status, or disability.
   

  

 Successful candidates might be required to undergo a background verification with an external vendor.
   

  

 Requisition ID: 427964 | Work Area: Sales | Expected Travel: 0 - 10% | Career Status: Professional | Employment Type: Regular Full Time | Additional Locations: .

title: Content Growth Manager
description:
**About Magma**
 Magma is a startup that has quickly grown to become the leading platform for data-driven math education. By leveraging handwritten solutions in a digital format, Magma allows teachers to place emphasis on creativity in math, while gaining key insights into student progression. This creates a more engaging, inclusive and pedagogical math class for all students.
   

  

 Math remains the largest challenge for schools, where one in five students are considered low performers. Math is one of the core pillars on which careers are built, and we believe that school math represents one of the largest opportunities at improving educational outcomes and career prospects for children and young adults.
   

  

 Magma is now growing rapidly across the US and Europe. We are an ambitious team on a meaningful mission of improving math education for millions of children.
   

  

 ‍
   

  

**The Role**
 We are looking for a builder who wants to help us scale our content – meaning math problems, theory, and everything else math-related you might find on a math platform – in ways that will eventually transform the role of a content creator at Magma, to a content moderator. In the content team, we have historically had pretty human-intensive content creation processes, no matter if it has been about creating or reviewing problems, aligning already existing content to various educational schemes, or about tagging relevant mathematical skills to problems. As a Scaling Content engineer, you will be part of a team of four, and work towards ensuring that our content creation processes become a lot more efficient. We are not thinking x2, x3 here, or even x10, but rather x1000. We want to automate as much as possible of our content creation processes to prepare for becoming a global company that can operate content in multiple languages – with high quality – with only a relatively small team of content moderators.
   

  

**Who You Are And What You Know**
 We are searching for a team member who wants to take large ownership of Magma's scaling content efforts. To succeed you need to:
   

  

* Be passionate about building stuff with big impact
* Have a big interest in AI and stay up-to-date with the latest releases
* Be very ambitious and like chasing challenging targets
* Be extremely output-oriented and find satisfaction in driving projects to completion
* Eager to learn new things, and have experience of building stuff
* Goal-oriented and accustomed to working towards deadlines in a structured manner
* Great at communicating
* Excellent at giving feedback to others, and adapting to feedback given to you
* Be hardworking and willing to join a fast-paced and rapidly growing startup


**Requirements**
* Bachelors degree in any field
* Coding skills that enable you to build stuff
* Fluent in English


**What We Offer**
* Play a key role in an exciting journey. We are a young company with ambitious targets and meaningful goals
* Fantastic colleagues in a fun environment with great opportunities to learn
* Full-time job with salary, benefits and stock options
* An opportunity to work on a meaningful mission and have an exceptional impact on education, society, and how children learn math across the world.


**Start:** 
 As soon as possible
   

  

**Location:** 
 Stockholm, Sweden.
   

  

**Note:** 
 We practice a
 **5** 
**day in office policy** 
 , and we look forward to working together closely with you :)

title: SAP TM Consultant
description:
**Job Title:** 
 SAP TM Consultant
 



**Location:** 
 Stockholm, Sweden
 



**Hybrid** 
 : 2-3 days per week on-site
 



**Experience Required:** 
 8–10 years
 



**Start date** 
 : ASAP
 



  





**Role Overview:** 




 We are looking for an experienced
 **SAP TM Functional Consultant** 
 to join our team in Stockholm. The ideal candidate will have strong expertise in SAP Transportation Management, including full lifecycle implementations, configuration, and support.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities:** 



* Lead or support end-to-end SAP TM implementations.
* Configure SAP TM modules for transportation planning, freight management, and execution.
* Integrate SAP TM with modules like SD, MM, EWM, and third-party logistics systems.
